item.title: LAN to WAN Ethernet Connections
item.description:
Ethernet is the standard protocol for local area networks (LANs), but connecting beyond a single location requires a way to bridge the gap to wide area network (WAN) technologies. Traditionally, this meant converting between protocols, which was inefficient. However, Metro and Carrier Ethernet connections now offer a seamless way to link LANs and WANs. Packet-based networks, especially those using IP, benefit significantly from using the same technology across the entire network...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/lan-to-wan-ethernet-connections/
